title: Number of earthquakes in Italy 2018 - 2019 , by magnitude
summary: This bar chart has 5 columns on the x axis representing Magnitude, and Number of earthquakes in each Magnitude on the y axis.
The Number of earthquakes is appeared to be the highest at Magnitude Magnitude 0+ and lowest at Magnitude Magnitude 5.5+.
There is a difference of 21869.0 between the maximum Magnitude Magnitude 0+ and minimum Magnitude Magnitude 5.5+.
min_summary: This bar chart has 5 columns on the x axis representing Magnitude, and Number of earthquakes in each Magnitude on the y axis.
The Number of earthquakes is appeared to be the highest at Magnitude Magnitude 0+ and lowest at Magnitude Magnitude 5.5+.

max_summary: This is a bar chart. It shows Number of earthquakes for 5 number of Magnitudes.
Magnitude Magnitude 0+ has the highest Number of earthquakes and Magnitude 5.5+ has the lowest Number of earthquakes.
The second highest Number of earthquakes is appeared to be the Magnitude Magnitude 2+.
The difference of Number of earthquakes between the highest and lowest Magnitude is 21869.0.
Magnitude Magnitude 0+ is higher than any other Magnitudes with value 21869.0, followed by Magnitude 2+, and Magnitude 3+. Down to Magnitude Magnitude 5.5+ with the lowest value 0.0.
The Magnitude Magnitude 0+ tends to be 4.46 percent higher than average.
Summing up the values of all Magnitudes, we get total 24499.0.
